page.title: 16TOURIST TRADE
page.content:
The beauty of this stretch of the Thames, with its distinctive bridge framed by the Berkshire Downs on the horizon, attracts visitors.
A caravan park is situated on the south bank of the river and is open all the year round with six permanent residents. The peak period is from mid July to the end of August during the school summer holidays. The ground covers three and one half acres and includes the amenities of an ablution block with showers and toilets. Camping charges are Â£4 for a caravan and Â£3 for a tent per night.
Problems are caused by flooding of the river, sometimes by as much as a few feet. During these periods permanent residents have to be moved to higher ground.
